HTN.summary: High blood pressure makes your heart work harder than it should. Over time, this can damage your heart, blood vessels, kidneys, and other organs.
HTN.medicationInfo: This medicine relaxes your blood vessels so your heart doesn't work as hard. Keep taking it even if your blood pressure feels normal.
lifestyleTips: Reduce sodium intake to less than 2,300mg per day
Exercise regularly - aim for 30 minutes most days
HTN.warningSign: Contact your doctor if you experience severe headache, chest pain, or vision problems.

DM.summary: Diabetes affects how your body processes blood sugar. Managing it well protects your heart, kidneys, eyes, and nerves.
DM.medicationInfo: Metformin helps your body use sugar better and protects your kidneys and heart. Take with food to reduce stomach upset.
lifestyleTips: Monitor your blood sugar as directed
Choose complex carbohydrates over simple sugars
Check your feet daily for any cuts or sores
DM.warningSign: Watch for signs of low blood sugar: shakiness, sweating, confusion. Keep glucose tablets handy.

CHOL.summary: High cholesterol can build up in your arteries and increase your risk of heart attack and stroke. You won't feel it, but treatment prevents future problems.
CHOL.medicationInfo: Statins protect your heart by lowering 'bad' cholesterol. You won't feel different day-to-day, but they prevent future heart problems.
lifestyleTips: Eat heart-healthy foods - more fish, nuts, and vegetables
Limit saturated fats and avoid trans fats
CHOL.warningSign: Report unexplained muscle pain or weakness to your doctor.
